translated: The Monastic Code of the Elders
The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on training rules
1. The training rule on swaying the body

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kāyappacālakaṁ antaraghare nisīdanti, kāyaṁ olambentā …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū kāyappacālakam antaraghare nisīdanti kāyam olambentā pe
translated: At that time the monks from the group of six were swaying their bodies while sitting in inhabited areas. …

analyzed: na kāyappacālakam antaraghare nisīdissāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will not sway my body while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
One should not sway one’s body while sitting in an inhabited area.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca kāyappacālakaṁ antaraghare nisīdati kāyaṁ olambento, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca kāyappacālakam antaraghare nisīdati kāyam olambento āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, sways his body while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: anāpatti  a san cit ca  assatiyā
translated: There is no offense🔽if it is unintentional;
if he is not thinking;🔽if he does not know;
if he is sick;🔽if he is traveling;🔽if there is a danger;
if he is the first offender.🔽The sixth training rule is finished.
